revised_title: Observation of an Extraordinary Hernia Inguinalis and Passage of Mercury Over the Sun
tldr: The author describes an extraordinary case of inguinal hernia, which resulted in the patient's death. The autopsy revealed massive gastrointestinal distention and inflammation, suggesting that the use of hot fomentations may have exacerbated the condition. The author also briefly mentions an observation of the passage of Mercury over the Sun on October 31, 1738.
